title: Coral sells Gala Bingo clubs for £241m ahead of Ladbrokes merger
text:
Tip : Use comma (,) to separate multiple quotes. Learn more... 
Mon, Oct 26, 2015, 10:50 GMT - UK Markets close in 5 hrs 40 mins Coral sells Gala Bingo clubs for £241m ahead of Ladbrokes merger By Peter Spence | Telegraph – 2 hours 26 minutes ago 
Caledonia Investments has snapped up 38pc of the UK retail bingo market 
Coral is offloading its Gala Bingo business to investment trust Caledonia Investments for £241m. 
The deal includes Gala's 130 clubs across the UK, with 1.1 million active members, representing 38pc of the UK's retail bingo market, according to Caledonia. 
The sale does not include Gala Coral's online bingo offering, galabingo.com. 
Duncan Johnson, head of unquoted investments at Caledonia, said that the bingo business' "defensive, enduring business model" offered strong cash generation and an attractive dividend yield, which "fits ideally with the investment criteria sought by Caledonia". 
Caledonia's unquoted holdings also include Park Holidays and asset manager Seven Investment Management. 
The sale comes as Ladbrokes (LSE: LAD.L - news ) ' and Gala Coral attempt a £2.3bn merger , which would create the biggest bookie in Britain by betting shops. 
However, there is concern the competition regulator might block the deal because the combined company would be too big, with a dominant position in the betting shop market. 
The Competition and Markets Authority is scrutinising the deal in a process expected to stretch into next year, and it is expected that the regulator might force the bookmakers to sell shops to secure clearance. 
Gala's bingo business delivered pre-tax profits of £33m in the year to September 26, and gross assets of £189.6m. 
Simon Wykes, who will remain as Gala Bingo CEO, said: "We are delighted to have secured Caledonia's backing. 
"We believe that Caledonia's longer term, supportive investment model will give Gala Bingo the stable platform from which we can continue to develop our market leading business." 
Jane Anscombe, an analyst at Edison Investment Research, said that the £240m cost of Gala Bingo "looks a good price for Caledonia". 
"But with Gala Coral keeping the successful online business Caledonia will need to work hard to manage the long-term downtrend in club admissions," she added. 
Ladbrokes' merger is expected to be the catalyst for a wave of deals that could transform the gambling industry . 
Gala Coral rival Mecca Bingo was not interested in buying the bingo clubs, according to Sky News .
